results.title: Silent voices
results.brief_description: Broken into three segments entitled ‘The Rape’, ‘The Miscarriage’ and ‘The Dream’, this expressionist animation poignantly conveys the emotional trauma experienced by a young woman who is sexually abused by her tyrannical father. A more fully realised version of ‘deCollage’ a shorter film by the same director

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: Yum yum noodles
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, Troy Innocent, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Time for a bowl of something hot, wet and instant - Yum Yum noodles. Buy some today! MSG added for good tasty flavour. A parody of a noodle advertisment that comments on stereotypes of Asian cultures.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: This is a history of New York
results.brief_description: ‘This is a History of New York’ chronicles the seven ages of mankind from Prehistory to the Space Age. In the Age of Hunters and Gatherers, stray dogs patrol the streets while the homeless forage for food. Later in the Medieval Period, crazed street preachers pace frantically before ominous gothic architecture. The richness of Cohen’s vision is found in this haunting imagery and the perception that the thriving city of New York is really the accumulation of humanity’s failures, as well as triumphs.

results.title: Suggested photo spots
results.brief_description: Strap on your seat belts and get comfortable for a 7,000 mile drive. This documentary invites you to travel along with the Center for Land Use Interpretation as they find Suggested Photo Spots across North America. Journey from coast to coast stopping long enough to take snap shots of unusual or exemplary land use sites across North America. You will even get to take a picture of Kodak’s own waste water treatment plant in Rochester, New York.

results.title: Stage struck
results.brief_description: The Australian performing arts makes its debut on the interactive stage with this vibrant CD ROM. Embark on an exciting tour of the theatre, visiting the various studios to construct a costume, create a script, or design and direct your own show. As you explore backstage you will discover a wealth of information on Australia’s entertainment industry. Take a tour on stage with a stage manager, or hang out in the Green Room with the artists and discover the range of performing arts companies. This CD ROM was made possible through a collaboration between NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Art), the University of Wollongong, The Australian Ballet, Opera Australia, and the Sydney Opera House. Easy to install, nice graphics and good sound. Comes with an instruction sheet to assist with navigation.

results.title: Buried in light
results.brief_description: In this work originally commissioned as a multi-screen installation, Cohen meditates on ‘a time between times’ as he travels through Central and Eastern Europe. The filmmaker invests his own dreamily elegiac images of sites of past horror and devastation with ‘found’ commentaries taken from radio announcers and museum guides. With a considered use of archival material, Cohen restores a deep and affecting agency to the ghosts of the past, even as he signals a concern with the encroaching signs of change being wrought on contemporary European societies. A lightness emerges, ultimately, in Cohen’s visually poetic and spiritually consoling ‘seven possibilities for colour beyond advertising’; a wry melancholy postscript the filmmaker proposes as a parting gift.

results.title: Corps flottant
results.brief_description: Cahen’s film is a video essay of a transitory reality depicted through the rhythms of rural life in Japan. Men bathe in the thermal springs of Kusatu, while an elderly woman tends to a rice paddy. Cahen creates a dream-like chronicle of the landscape and develops a painterly impression of the figures who exist within that landscape.

results.title: Sodium vapor (including Constellation and Oracle)
results.creator_credit: Bill Viola and TV Lab at WNET/Thirteen
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Writes Viola: `Sodium Vapor was recorded over a period of several weeks in the hours between one and five in the morning on the streets of an industrial area in lower Manhattan. The title derives from an interest in the particular qualities of sodium vapor street lighting — its characteristic color temperature, the shadows it casts, and the eerie quality it seems to impart to the objects it illuminates. The essence of the work is the spell which the hour has over the physical spaces of the streets in the early morning. There is always the unseen presence of the large number of people surrounding you, most of them sleeping; the camera is awake in their dreamtime. The recording of these locations in the middle of the night rather than in daylight represents a transformation — like figure/ground reversal — of these physical spaces from the familiar thoughts and activities of the day to the night time shadows of emptiness and obscurity.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Viola and TV Lab at WNET/Thirteen
